text:
Is your English holding your love back? Well,
you need not worry because this lesson is

all about love vocabulary. If you are madly
in love with someone there are certain phrases

that you can use this Valentines. So let's
have a look.

Hey friends it's me Niharika and welcome back
to a new lesson. In today's lesson we are

gonna have a look at some love vocabulary.
Oh Yes, it's a great time to celebrate your

love if you are involved in a romantic relationship
with someone or probably want to be involved

in a romantic relationships with someone then
14th February is the right day to celebrate

your love. Now in this lesson today we are
gonna have a look at some love vocabulary.

So let's get started, the very first one that
I have for is Blind date. Okay, what is blind

date? Well, blind date is when you go on a
date, romantic date with someone whom you

haven't met before. SO have you ever gone
for a blind date? Well you don't know that

person very well, probably your friend has
arranged a date for you, probably your friend

works with this person and called you that
hey why don't you go for a date.So that's

a blind date, when you don't know the person,
you haven't met the person before but you

still go on a romantic date with him or her.
SO it's going on a date with someone you have
never met.

Moving on to the next phrase that I have for
you which is double date. Okay, so what is

double date? Well we learnt about blind date
but now when it comes to double date, it means

that two couples going on a date together.
So you and your boyfriend and your friend

along with his or her partner, yes, y'all
go out together, probably y'all go for a dinner

or just for drinks or probably you go out
for a movie. So, it is a date but it's not

just you and your partner alone but you are
also with your friends. Okay, so two couples
going on a date, that's double date.

Moving on to the next one, will you be my
Valentine? well, what does this really mean?

Now if you wanna go out with someone, you
are crazy for this person and you want to

go out with this person and you want to pop
up that question, so how do you do that? Well

this is the right question that you can ask.
Hey will you be my valentine? So you are prompting

that person that Hey I like you and I would
like to spend my valentine's day with you.

So either you can say will you be my valentine
or probably you can ask a little more formal

question which is would you like to go out
with me on 14th of February?

Moving on to the next one is to be lovesick.
Now what does this really mean? To be lovesick.

Is this some kind of a sickness. Do you need
to visit a doctor? Well, do not worry. Being

lovesick is just basically you are crazy for
someone, you are so attracted to a person

that all day long what you do is just think
about this person and that's about it. You

just can't concentrate on your work, you are
so much crazily in love with this person.

So that is being lovesick. You know when you
around this person that you love, you have

a crush on this person and you have these
butterflies in your tummy and you go so crazy

when you are around the person you like then
you are being lovesick. Okay, so that's to
be lovesick.

Moving on to the next one that I have for
you is Me right. I am still waiting for my

Mr Right. Well this is a great phrase for
women. If you haven't found the right, ideal

person that you would like to go on a date
with or you would like to get married to then

yes you are still waiting for your Mr right.
So Mr right is an ideal future husband. Like

someone who is so loving, caring, understanding.
You know, there are very few men who are really

nice, like they are just perfect. SO women,
if you haven't found your Mr right then it's

worth waiting. Don't just jump into any relationship
with some random guy. So a great phrase for

women who can use it this Valentine's , Hey
I am not going on a date because I haven't

met my Mr right yet. Okay, moving on to the
next one is love to pieces. When you use this

phrase it means that you are expressing your
love to someone, when you are crazily in love

with someone you can say "Oh my God, I love
you to pieces" So love you to pieces it means

that you really love this person. So to love
someone very much. And the next one that I

have for you again is to express your love
for someone is love to the moon and back.

Oh my god I love you so much. So rather than
saying I love you so much use this phrase

instead. I love you to the moon and back.
Wow, have you thought about the distance between

the earth and the moon and the return as well,
that's like too much. So here you are trying

to express that I love you so so so much.
So a great phrase to express your love. You

can either use it in a very romantic way but
you can also use it for your friends and for

your family members. Like if I have to use
it for my mom, I love her so much I would
say " Oh Mom I love you to the moon and back"

Moving on to the last one that you can use
this Valentine's or just in general is to

pop the question. Well have you popped the
question yet? SO what does this really mean?

Well question, what kind of question are you
talking about? To pop the question means have

you proposed your partner? Like for example
when you have to propose a girl you get down

on your knees and you present a ring, yes
that's proposing for marriage. SO to pop the

question it means to ask someone to get married.
So either you can say have you popped the

question yet or you can also say have you
gone down on your knees yet? So it just means

the same to propose your partner. SO these
are eight wonderful love expressions that

you can use this valentine's. So don't let
your English hold your love back, start using

these phrases and wish you a very happy valentine's
day. I will be back with a new lesson soon,
till then you take care
